data.text:
Courteney Cox rose to fame with her iconic role as Monica Geller in the hit television series “Friends”, which aired from 1994 to 2004. Her comedic performance and endearing character captured the hearts of viewers around the world, making her catapulted to stardom. Before finding success with “Friends,” Cox already had a well-established career in Hollywood, with appearances in several films and television series. However, it was her role in the cult series that made her a true television icon.

After “Friends”, she continued to act in various film and television productions, and was also successful as a producer. In addition to her acting career, Cox is also known for her involvement in various charities and serving as a spokesperson for several brands.

Courteney Cox, born June 15, 1964 in Alabama, is an American actress acclaimed in the entertainment industry for her versatile talent and undeniable charm. Having started her career as a model, Cox quickly moved to television where she achieved immense success thanks to her iconic role as Monica Geller in the cult series “Friends”. His portrayal of this eccentric and lovable character has earned him worldwide recognition and the affection of a devoted fan base.

Cox has also excelled on the big screen, with memorable roles in films such as “Scream” where she played the character of Gale Weathers, a reckless journalist, as well as in “Ace Ventura: Pet Detective”, alongside Jim Carrey. Aside from her acting career, Cox is also an accomplished television producer, having worked on hit series such as “Cougar Town” and “Dirt.” She is admired for her timeless beauty and elegant style, making her a fashion icon. Courteney Cox continues to impress with her charismatic presence and talent, securing a permanent place in the entertainment industry.

Courteney Cox, famous American actress, was born on June 15, 1964 in Birmingham, Alabama. She is the daughter of Richard Lewis Cox, a businessman, and Courteney Bass, a former dancer. On her father’s side, she is of English, Scottish and Irish origin, descended in particular from Mayflower Pilgrims. On her mother’s side, she is of German and Swedish ancestry. Courteney Cox has two older sisters, Virginia and Dorothy. She grew up in a wealthy family in Mountain Brook, a suburb of Birmingham. Regarding her marital life, she has been married twice. First, in 1999, she married actor David Arquette. The couple had a daughter together, named Coco, born in 2004.

Unfortunately, they announced their separation in 2010 and their divorce was finalized in 2013. Subsequently, Courteney Cox began a relationship with musician Johnny McDaid of the group Snow Patrol. They got engaged in 2014 before breaking up in 2015. However, they reconciled and announced their engagement a second time in 2019. Professionally, Courteney Cox is best known for her iconic role as Monica Geller in the famous series television “Friends” (1994-2004). She also starred in other successful films and television series, cementing her fame in the entertainment industry.
